_comment: GENERAL NOTE: optional arguments should be left in, as the runner does not check whether a param is required for a model and may cause an interrupt.
all times below are in milliseconds
below only relevant for DTPDRL
dataset_size: how many samples to present
implemented activations: logistic, hard_sigmoid, relu, soft_relu, linear, tanh
implemented models: BP, FA, DTPDRL
DTPDRL-only: sampled noise is rescaled by noise_scale
DTPDRL and uP_adaptive-only: noise_deg is the angle of alignment between uP_breve_i and BPP_iL * rP_breve_L below which no noise is injected
i.e. we are satisfied with this amount of alignment
DTPDRL-only: implemented modes: uP (scale noise with uP), vapi (scale noise with vapi) and uP_adaptive (scale noise with uP and angle of alignment)
weights are initialised as numpy.random.uniform with range defined below. WIP and BPI are overridden by init_in_SPS=True
FA and DTPDRL-only: range of BPP
DTPDRL-only: alpha is the scaling factor of the regularizer
array of seeds
whether to set *the* self-predicting state during initialisation
DTPDRL-only: low-pass on interneuron
DTPDRL-only: high-pass on output layer pyramidal neurons
DTPDRL-only: low-pass on updates of WPP
DTPDRL-only: whether to apply regularizer only if rP_breve > 0
input signal, possibilites: step
